hint.text:
Example : \(500 = 5.0 \times 10^{2} = 5 \times 10^{2}\).
Here, the decimal point is shifted two places towards the left. Therefore, the exponent value of \(10\,\) is \(2\)

solution.text: _{{k*10000}}_ can also be written as \( _{{k* Decimal('0.01')}}_ \times 10^6 \). Thus the power of 10 is 6

content.text: The power of 10 in the standard form of _{{k*10000}}_ is ?
